overview: This subject provides students with a continuation in training in research methods to deepen their understanding of evidence-based clinical practice and critical review of the scientific literature. The scholarly literacy of students is enhanced through research, analysis and reference management skills. Scientific oral and written communication skills are honed through the production of a scientific literature review and an oral presentation to student peers.

assessments.description: Written peer reviews of two draft literature reviews (Up to 250 words each). 500 words (total). Hurdle requirement:. The written peer reviews must be submitted by the deadline and be of a satisfactory standard.

assessments.timing: In the second half of the semester

assessments.description: Scientific literature review (up to 1500 words) (15% – Draft review and 50% – Final review). 1500 words. Hurdle requirement:. The draft and final versions of the literature review must be submitted by the deadlines and be of a satisfactory standard.
assessments.timing:
Draft due approximately Week 4 of Semester 2;
final version due end of Week 13 of Semester 2

assessments.description: Aggregate Mark. Hurdle requirement:. Students must pass the subject on aggregate mark.

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
